name: IntraMaps Roam
tagline: Simple and flexible data collection built using QGIS.
body:
IntraMaps Roam is a field, and office, data collection application built using the QGIS libraries and Python. It was built to be easy to use on (windows) based devices in an offline situation without a internet connection and the need for easy to use data collection. Roam supports point, line, and polygon capture, include Point at GPS capture.

Roam supports custom Qt forms, or the much simpler but much more rapid, auto generated forms.  Both form types support the same widget types and allow for custom Python logic to be added in order to fit the exact workflow needed.

![](https://github.com/DMS-Aus/Roam/wiki/images/2.2-Release.png)

![](https://github.com/DMS-Aus/Roam/wiki/images/2.2-Release.png)

## Latest Release

The latest release is [**V2.3.1**](https://github.com/DMS-Aus/Roam/releases)

## Major Features 2.3

Newest [features in 2.2 include:](https://github.com/DMS-Aus/Roam/wiki/Features-2.3)

* Search plugin
* Support for using sqlite in info panel
* Feature attributes passed to info queries
* Skip edit buffer for saving (should make edits faster)
* Compress Info panel buttons to single row
* Delete button moved to top for image widget 
* Move message bar to bottom of screen and style a bit nicer
* Travis CI testing for test suite
* Solid outline for selection

## Major Features 2.2

Newest [features in 2.2 include:](https://github.com/DMS-Aus/Roam/wiki/Features-2.2)

* Built on QGIS 2.4
* Info2 and Info1 block support
* Support for enable/disable of capture, edit, edit geom modes on layers
* Plugin model for extra side pages
* Better link support in info panel
* Image file saving support
* New option row widget
* New multi select list
* New Number stepper widget
* Search in list widgets

## Getting Started

See the [**wiki**](https://github.com/DMS-Aus/Roam/wiki) for information on how to create a project and user guides.

## Open source to the core

IntraMaps Roam is built on Python and QGIS and is licensed under the GPL
